name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Robert COLLINS, Appellant

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Robert COLLINS, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: David C. Harrison, Philadelphia, for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Chief, Appeals Div., Deborah Glass, Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
385 A.2d 966
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. Robert COLLINS, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 22, 1977.
Decided April 28, 1978.
David C. Harrison, Philadelphia, for appellant.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Chief, Appeals Div., Deborah Glass, Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellee.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
